Related publications are listed in the metadata section of the Dataverse study.

fields.value: Cassava Breeding Trials - Edaphoclimatic Zone 2: Lowland Tropics; Acid Soils; Medium to High Precipitation

dsDescriptionValue.value:
Cassava germplasm development at CIAT is centered on the development of improved gene pools for specific edapho-climatic zones with importance for cassava production. The most relevant ecosystems are the semi-and and sub-humid tropics, for which the majority of efforts are devoted. The main selection activity is conducted in sites selected to represent the conditions of the target ecosystem. For each zone, a recurrent selection program with a progressive set of stages is followed. As the stages progress more emphasis is given to traits of lower heritability, because more planting material for each genotype is available and the evaluation can be conducted in bigger plots with replications. Certain selection criteria are of general Importance across ecosystems (i.e. yield potential, dry matter content), while others are specific for each ecosystem (i e. specific pests and/or diseases).

This dataset provides CIAT cassava breeding trial data for activities conducted in the Acid soil savannas; moderate to long dry season; low relative humidity during dry season, Zone.

publicationCitation.value: Hershey, Clair H. "Breeding cassava for adaptation to stress conditions: development of a methodology." Proc. of the 6th Symp. of the Int. Society for tropical Roots Crops. 1983.

Ceballos, Hernán; Pérez Velásquez, Juan Carlos; Calle, Fernando; Jaramillo O., Gustavo; Lenis Calderón, Jorge Iván; Morante, Nelson; López, J. 2007. A new evaluation scheme for cassava breeding at CIAT. In: Howeler, Reinhardt H. (ed.). Cassava research and development in Asia: Exploring new opportunities for an ancient crop: Proceedings of the seventh regional workshop held in Bangkok, Thailand, Oct 28-Nov 1, 2002. Centro Internacional de Agricultura Tropical (CIAT), Cassava Office for Asia, Bangkok, TH. p. 125-135.
Iglesias, Carlos A., and Clair H. Hershey. "Cassava breeding at CIAT: heritability estimates and genetic progress in the 1980s." Symposium on Tropical Root Crops in a Developping Economy 380. 1991.
Jennings, D. L., and C. H. Hershey. "Cassava breeding: a decade of progress from international programmes." Progress in plant breeding 1 (1985): 89-115.
Hershey, Clair H. "Breeding cassava for adaptation to stress conditions: development of a methodology." Proc. of the 6th Symp. of the Int. Society for tropical Roots Crops. 1983.
